head.title: North Bergen School Closings - COVID-19 - 3/20/20 | North Bergen School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: The North Bergen School District is a neighborhood based school system serving students from Pre-Kindergarten to High School. The North Bergen School System curriculum is aligned with the New Jersey State Core Curriculum Content Standards and State Assessment Program.

textarea.aria-label: Transcript for North Bergen School Closings - COVID-19 - 3/20/20

div.textarea:
Hello my name is Dr. George Solter, superintendent of the North Bergen School District. I wanted to give everyone an update on the situation regarding school closures due to COVID 19. ● Schools will remain closed until April 20th, therefore students must complete the packets or remote learning assignments given to them prior to leaving school by next sunday March 29th. Starting Monday March 30th students will be moving to virtual lessons in grades 1- 12. Our Virtual School Day plan will be posted next week. Students in grades K-2 will find their information on their teachers webpage. Grades 3-12 will be on google classroom & lessons, information, & assignments will be posted there. Students should be keeping a reading log & writing journal online or on paper. Our expectations are that students will login at 9 am and will be working remotely on their assignments until 1:10 pm. Between 2 and 3pm teachers will be available virtually, online and via email for conferences with students when needed. Teachers will also be preparing their lessons during this time. All assignments are to be submitted to the teacher in a timely manner. If the student has extenuating circumstances and can’t complete the assignment by the due date, please email the teacher for an extended deadline. Our guidance counselors & child study team members will be available for students to contact them with questions & concerns or emotional support. We will be posting social & emotional learning videos on our school & district websites. We are also posting exercise & yoga videos so students can remain active. Our teachers will be working on creating videos whether live or pre-recorded so the students can have a sense of normalcy. This is an unprecedented time . We have never dealt with anything like this before. Our focus is to keep a sense of normalcy and structure for students and staff during this time of uncertainty. We are also asking everyone to please practice safe habits, wash your hands, keep social distancing, & stay away from anyone exhibiting symptoms.
If you are feeling sick, make sure to follow the guidelines posted on our websites that are from the CDC & the dept. of health.
Please visit our school website on a daily basis for information, read our emails & text messages, & listen to our automated announcements for further information.
If you need to update your contact information please go to the Parent Portal on our school website or email the school counselor.
I wish everyone safety during this time.

img.alt: My Five Senses read by: Janenne Eustic

li.p: Sight, smell, hear, taste, and touch are the five sense you use to enjoy the world. Enjoy this read aloud describing your five senses.
li.span: Uploaded Jun 17, 2019 to English Language Arts

li.p: This is the video of the NBHS Ladies' Ensemble performing at the Hudson County Teen Arts Festival. They were awarded Top Honors out of 10 ensembles participating. They will now go on to represent the county at the State Teen Arts Festival.
